snippet: The United States has offered $10 million for help convicting Hafiz Muhammad Saeed, the Pakistani founder of the group behind the 2008 attacks in Mumbai, India.
abstract: United States is offering $10 million for help convicting Hafiz Muhammad Saeed, Pakistan's best-known jihadi leader and founder of Lashkar-e-Taiba, group behind 2008 attacks in Mumbai, India; Saeed lives openly in middle-class neighborhood in Lahore, shielded not only by his supporters, but also by Pakistani state.
lead_paragraph: The United States has offered $10 million for help convicting Hafiz Muhammad Saeed, the Pakistani founder of the group behind the 2008 attacks in Mumbai, India.

headline.seo: Lashkar-e-Taiba Founder Takes Less Militant Tone in Pakistan
headline.main: Pakistani Militant, Price on Head, Lives in Open
headline.print_headline: Pakistani Militant, Price on Head, Lives in Open
